review_title: Mott Community College is an excellent educational institution to work at.
pros: Little to no work pressure; great benefits; College campus, despite being in Flint, is very safe.  Public Safety patrols around the clock and provide additional support such as inflating flat tires, charging car batteries, opening classrooms.  They are usually there within minutes.  Rarely will you ever wait longer than five minutes. Most classrooms are equipped with at least instructor computers, in-built overhead projector/cam and sound.
cons: No upward movement in college setting possible - you will most likely stay at same position for duration of employment.  Applying to more senior-level positions, even with experience is virtually nil once you've been hired.  Mott usually only hires fresh candidates. Negotiate salary before being hired because you will not be able to negotiate afterwards.  Mott will adjust for standard inflation increases but only occasionally.  Security cameras are in Curtis Mott complex only but not other buildings.  Parking ramp activity is not recorded even though thefts, including auto thefts have occurred - they are only monitored.  IT Services will eventually fix issues related to classroom internet connectivity but it may take a week and even longer so be prepared with handouts.

pros: Respects your class schedule, you get holidays off, still get summers off. I was able to do homework while working, and the place I worked was very quiet and low-key. I felt like I was being paid to do nothing (not that I wasn't doing anything - but I enjoyed working for the VADC).
cons: Low pay, low hours. When I started working at MCC you could work up to 24 hours a week, and during my last semester, I was only given 15 hours a week max. While working in the art building I noticed there were potential flaws in the security of the VADC (Visual Arts and Design Center).

pros: Self-guided, course design support, opportunities to fill in professors and make extra money.
cons: Low Pay (less than 3k dollars per course), Issues with race at the college, no structure of dual enrolled classes that have high school students.

pros: understanding about homework, lots of interactions with students, gave me a chance to hone and improve my skills, wonderful supervisors, challenging atmosphere
cons: understaffed in my division, faculty plays mindgames with you, hours kept being cut due to college policy change, some faculty was subpar

pros: good atmosphere, nice people decent pay, and for the most you keep busy which is very important to a productive work day.
cons: not enough hours, no full time employment, and no room for full time positions, which is a down fall for me, but other than that its a nice place to work.

pros: People are genuine and staff tend to want to do the right thing. Within the departments, people want to get to know each other.
cons: Executive leadership has created a culture of discipline and mistrust. This has reached all the way down to the lowest level of staff and there is resentment toward executive leadership.

review_title: I had a great experience working for Mott in different departments
pros: Learning new thing that can help you along in life.
cons: A lot of staff have very old school ways and not willing to learn new things. If you don't know someone in a higher pay grade let's just say you may be gone soon.

pros: Awesome knowledgeable staff that lead you in the right direction.  Setup and structure very defined.
cons: For a beginner,  there was a lot to go through and not much startup structure, but it is a huge system to maintain and going through it is part of the fun.

pros: Excellent sense of community and support even for part-time instructors. A good balance of direction and freedom with curriculum. Always a positive atmosphere.
cons: Limited opportunity for growth and promotion, which is the norm for post-secondary educational institutions.

pros: Pay is competitive. Colleagues are great!
cons: Mismanagement of leadership is a huge concern. Falling enrollment is unstable. Tuition cost is one of the highest community college in the state.

pros: Cheap courses, very friendly environment.
cons: It's community college, so you're only going to get what you pay for.

pros: Flexible hours. Study time. Fun

pros: It helped to pay some bills.
